pr_title: Identify and shutdown leaked timer threads

timeline.message:
Identify and shutdown leaked timer threads #1200

Unit test has leaked several hundreds to thousand leaked timer threads.
This pull request give each timer thread a name to help identified the
leaked threads. Also fix the major contributor of leaking in controller.

timeline.bodyText: Shall we also stopOnDemandTimer on the FINALIZE notification? This is done for the PeriodRebalance timer.
timeline.author: jiajunwang

replies.bodyText: I noticed it too. periodicalRebalanceTimer would be canceled in Finalize and created in init time. But this timer (added for p2p) did not do this. Maybe it is for a reason. (Not that familiar with P2P) I am afraid changing its life cycle may cause some unexpected behavior.
replies.author: kaisun2000

replies.bodyText:
In theory, if a FINALIZE notification comes, then we should stop any pending tasks. Or it will keep running even without the later INIT notification comes.
But I agree that this PR won't make it worse. We can skip that change for now.
replies.author: jiajunwang

timeline.bodyText:
nit, let's call this shutdownOnDemandTimer.
Considering the periodRebalanceTimer can be started and stopped repeatedly. But this shutdownOnDemandTimer will be one-time thing in our logic.
timeline.author: jiajunwang
